sub_subject.name: Practical Theology & Christian Living
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Practical Theology & Christian Living (Bible & Theology)

objectives.objective_text: Identify the Ten Commandments as God's rules for living.
Name lying and stealing as wrong.
Identify holiness as being like Jesus.
Name sin as the opposite of holiness.
Identify prayer as talking to God our Father.
Name the Lord's Prayer.
Identify the Fruit of the Spirit as good things God grows in us.
Name Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness, Self-control.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Regulative vs. Normative Principles of Worship
objectives.objective_text: Identify that we worship God how He likes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Regulative vs. Normative Principles of Worship
objectives.objective_text: Name the Bible as our guide for church.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Regulative vs. Normative Principles of Worship
objectives.objective_text: Identify elements commanded (Singing, Reading, Preaching).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Identify singing, praying, and listening.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Name the sermon.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Benediction (Blessing).
Identify water for Baptism.
Name bread and cup for Communion.
Identify who should participate.
Identify praying in my room.
Name going to church on Sunday.
Identify Family Worship.
Recall that we should love our neighbor.
Observe that God sees everything we do.
Recall that the Holy Spirit helps us be good.
Observe that God is happy when we obey.
Recall that God always hears us.
Observe that Jesus prayed often.
Recall that a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.
Observe how Jesus showed these fruits.

objectives.objective_text: Identify a family.

objectives.objective_text: Name marriage as God's idea.

objectives.objective_text: Identify children as a blessing (Psalm 127).

objectives.objective_text: Identify work as good.

objectives.objective_text: Name God as the first Worker.

objectives.objective_text: Identify laziness as sin.

objectives.objective_text: Identify time as a gift.

objectives.objective_text: Name my body as a temple.

objectives.objective_text: Identify healthy habits as worship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Regulative vs. Normative Principles of Worship
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Nadab and Abihu offered 'strange fire'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Regulative vs. Normative Principles of Worship
objectives.objective_text: Observe order in the service.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that we do this together.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Observe the reading of the Bible.
Recall that Jesus told us to do these things.
Observe a baptism or the Lord's Supper.
Recall that we need both.
Observe families worshipping.
Summarize the two greatest commandments (Love God, Love Neighbor).
Explain why we tell the truth (because God is Truth).
Explain the Christian view of work and laziness.
Defend objective morality against moral relativism.
Summarize the command 'Be holy for I am holy'.
Explain the difference between justification (one time) and sanctification (ongoing).
Explain the Puritan concept of the 'Mortification of Sin' (killing sin).
Defend the necessity of holiness ('without which no one will see the Lord').
Summarize the A.C.T.S. model (Adoration, Confession, Thanksgiving, Supplication).
Explain why we pray 'in Jesus' name'.
Explain the discipline of fasting as an aid to prayer.
Defend the effectiveness of prayer against deistic views.
Summarize Galatians 5:22-23.
Explain that we cannot grow this fruit without the Spirit.
Explain how 'Patience' relates to suffering.
Defend the idea that character matters more than gifts.
Produce an essay on how the Spirit produces fruit through abiding (John 15).

objectives.objective_text: Recall honoring father and mother.

objectives.sub_topic_name: A Theology of Marriage and Parenting
objectives.objective_text: Observe love in the home.

objectives.objective_text: Recall that we take care of the earth.

objectives.objective_text: Observe people helping others through jobs.

objectives.objective_text: Explain: Do what is not forbidden (Normative).

objectives.objective_text: Defend the freedom of conscience in worship.

objectives.objective_text: Summarize the dialogical nature of worship (God speaks, we respond).

objectives.objective_text: Explain the Call to Worship.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the 'Ordinary Means of Grace'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Corporate Worship (Word, Sacrament, Prayer)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the necessity of preaching.
Summarize Baptism (sign of entry).
Explain Communion (sign of staying/remembering).
Explain the Passover connection to the Supper.
Defend the serious nature of the Table (1 Cor 11).
Summarize the 'Secret Place' (Matthew 6).
Explain 'Do not forsake the assembling' (Hebrews 10).
Explain the Lord's Day (Sabbath) observance.
Defend the physical gathering of believers.
Identify money as a tool.
Name sharing as good.
Identify debt as a burden.
Compare what the world says is right with what the Bible says.
Apply the Golden Rule to bullying.
Analyze the Sermon on the Mount ethics (anger = murder, lust = adultery).
Interpret the relationship between Law and Grace in ethics.
Connect the value of life (Imago Dei) to issues like abortion.
Compare worldly happiness with biblical joy.
Apply the 'put off / put on' principle (Ephesians 4).
Analyze the concept of 'Progressive Sanctification'.
Interpret the struggle with the flesh in Romans 7.
Connect holiness to witness (being salt and light).
Compare private prayer with corporate (group) prayer.
Apply the practice of praying for enemies.
Analyze the prayers of Paul in the Epistles.
Interpret the role of the Holy Spirit in intercession (Romans 8).
Connect prayer to the sovereignty of God (Why pray if God knows?).
Compare the 'Works of the Flesh' with the 'Fruit of the Spirit'.
Apply 'Self-control' to a specific situation (like anger or eating).
Analyze why it is 'Fruit' (singular) and not 'Fruits' (plural).
Interpret the meaning of 'Faithfulness' in a covenant context.
Connect the fruit of the Spirit to the character of Christ.

Interpret 'This is my body'.
Connect Baptism to circumcision (Colossians 2).
Compare 'Me and Jesus' with 'Us and Jesus'.
Analyze the unique blessings of the corporate gathering.
Interpret the church as a body (cannot survive alone).
Connect private piety to public power.

Observe tithing.
Evaluate ethical dilemmas (e.g., war, bioethics) through a scriptural lens.
Evaluate legalism vs. antinomianism in the pursuit of holiness.

Construct a study on the Greek term 'Agape' (Love).
